channel.title: Login help
channel.description:
Ok i have been making a server (edditing) and i have done all the edditing , i have a problem, i have portforward,got no-ip running and have changed the localhost and 127.0.0.1 and the origanl no-ip but i only can log into localhost not my no-ip and i have went through all the .java and had a look but cant find any problems i was wondering if anyone else has the same problem with me and has resolved it, so someone please give me an answer.
thank

item.title: Login help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Here:

Connecting to server from YOUR computer, and the server is running on YOUR computer -> IP: 127.0.0.1
Connecting to server from YOUR computer, and the server is NOT running on your computer - > IP: blah-blah.no-ip.org

Read full topic

item.title: Login help
item.dc:creator: @Residence Residence
item.description:
@Residence wrote:

why ?
and how am i ment to test if other people can log in ?

Read full topic

item.title: Login help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

If YOU are connecting to a server running on the SAME computer That your connecting from, you MUST use 127.0.0.1

Read full topic

item.title: Login help
item.dc:creator: @Residence Residence
item.description:
@Residence wrote:

Thank You, and i have just done that lol as soon as you replied i had just finished doing that i was following a tutorial but it was for xp and as i have vista i had to do it a different way then i found out after 15 mins, but thanks if that dont work i think i will find out or somthing lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Login help
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

I think it’s called static ip address.
I called, waited 6 days and they made it (Had to call them atleast 10 times :D)
How to make an exception: http://www.serverintellect.com/support/windowsserversecurity/windows-firewall-exception.aspx

Read full topic

item.title: Login help
item.dc:creator: @Residence Residence
item.description:
@Residence wrote:

not sure, if not how do i do it ? thanks for the help not sure if i will do that though but first i will try that last thing you said, so can you please give me a link or some instructions, thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Login help
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

I had the same problem once, i had to call my ISP to make my ip address “real”, that’s how we call it. I don’t know how to say it here.
Also, did you add an exception in your firewall?

Read full topic
